ygData.subject: Heads up on coming Heritrix developments
ygData.msgSnippet: Heritrix 1.10.2 should be released any day now.  Its primarily a bug-fix release with a few small improvements but the main motivation for putting out 1.10.2

Subject: Heads up on coming Heritrix developments
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281; y=41CwX4WlWJn2fFxYa5W_FzAGzhM9qlaB2p3d_6LoqFhdZf9EgZdhzE7W
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

Heritrix 1.10.2 should be released any day now.  Its primarily a bug-fix 
release with a few small improvements but the main motivation for 
putting out 1.10.2 at this particular time is that we are about to do 
radical surgery on the Heritrix source tree.

1.10.2 will be the last Heritrix version built out of CVS using maven 
1.0.x.  Over the next week or so we will move Heritrix source to 
subversion and our build system to maven 2.0.  Once complete, Heritrix 
source will undergo further churn as we merge in the 
"Root_pjack_settings" branch into TRUNK.  Paul Jack has been working on 
a new Heritrix settings system, in short, to make Heritrix components 
usable outside of a Heritrix context and more amenable to unit testing.  
Almost every processor and most of the UI has been touched by the 
refactoring (How settings are persisted to disk -- the order.xml -- will 
also likely change though we expect to provide tools to help migrate 
your settings investments).  Expect a note from Paul soon with an 
overview.  Meantime, the brave can take a look at the new system out on 
the branch but be warned that currently only the cognoscenti can make 
the "Root_pjack_settings" branch actually perform crawls.

We're shooting for a March release for the release to follow 1.10.2.

Other changes to expect are a move of our issue tracking and wiki from 
sourceforge to JIRA and Confluence systems hosted here at the Archive 
courtesy of an Open Source Project/Non-Profit Atlassian license.

As always, questions or commentary are welcome.

Yours,
The Internet Archive Webteam
